page.title: 16ROCK CHAPEL/ST.MARY'S(CofE)
page.content:
During the 19th century Methodism was important to the people. A Chapel was built at the Rock. The first part of it was built in 1861. The stone came from a nearby quarry. The second part was built in 1877. Before they had the Chapel people met in a cottage. In 1851 there were 48 people meeting there. In 1976 there were 12 members at the Rock Chapel.
The local church is St. Mary the Virgin (C. of E.) at Red Lake. It was built in 1799 from grey stone. It has large stained glass windows. It has a graveyard round it. One of the graves said that a man was 100 years old when he died. Outside the gate is an old pump which gave water to the village.
